Windows XPVistabootmgrWindows XP(RMPrepUSB [Tutorial 30](http://www.rmprepusb.com/tutorials/install-xp-from-an-iso)) 2\. Windows XPISO(F:\BootUSB\WXP\XP.iso) 3\. [winvblock.ima.gz](http://www.rmprepusb.com/documents/rmprepusb-beta-versions/winvblock.ima.gz?attredirects=0)(F:\BootUSB\winvblock.ima.gz) 4\. Menu.lst ``` > title Install Windows XP - STEP 1\nRemember press <F6> to load WinVBlock driver!! > set MYISO=XP.ISO > find --set-root --ignore-floppies --ignore-cd /winvblock.ima.gz > map --mem /winvblock.ima.gz (fd0) > map --mem /winvblock.ima.gz  (fd1) > # if this loads the ISO into memory slowly - then you need to run WinContig on the ISO file on your USB drive to speed it up! > map  /WXP/%MYISO% (0xff) || map  --mem /WXP/%MYISO% (0xff) > map (hd0) (hd1) > map (hd1) (hd0) > map --hook > root (0xff) > chainloader (0xff) > title  > Install Windows XP - STEP 2 (RAM > 1GB)\nContinue to install Windows XP with RAM > 1GB > set MYISO=XP.ISO > find --set-root --ignore-floppies --ignore-cd /winvblock.ima.gz > # we must load the ISO into memory, so it will be slow to load here ... > echo Loading... > map --mem /WXP/%MYISO% (0xff) || map  /WXP/%MYISO% (0xff) > map (hd0) (hd1) > map (hd1) (hd0) > map --hook > chainloader (hd0)+1 > pause Press ENTER and then unplug this USB drive... > title  > Install Windows XP - STEP 2 (RAM < 1GB)\nContinue to install Windows XP with RAM < 1GB > set MYISO=XP.ISO > map --mem /winvblock.ima.gz (fd0) > map --mem /winvblock.ima.gz  (fd1) > map /WXP/%MYISO% (0xA0) > checkrange 0x80 read 0x8280 && map (hd0) (hd1) > checkrange 0x80 read 0x8280 && map (hd1) (hd0) > map --hook > map --rd-size=2048 > map --mem (rd)+4 (0x55) > map --rehook > write (0x55) #!GRUB4DOS\x00v=1\x00WXP/%MYISO%\x00\xA0\x00 > root (hd0,0) > chainloader (hd0)+1 > pause Keep the USB drive connected until Setup completes! ``` 5\. USBWindows XPXPF6"FiraDisk Driver"USBWindows XP B. Windows 8 1\. Windows 8Windows 7Windows 8 ISO(Release PreviewServer 2012)([FiraDisk\au.xml]) 2\. ``` > title Install Windows 8\nThis will install Windows 8 to your hard disk > debug off > set MYISO=WIN8.ISO > dd if=()/firadisk/auWin8.xml of=()/AutoUnattend.xml > dd if=()/firadisk/spaces.txt of=()/firadisk/ISONAME.CMD > write ()/firadisk/ISONAME.CMD SET MYISO=\\iso\\%MYISO%\r\n > map --mem (md)0x800+4 (99) > map /ISO/%MYISO% (0xff) > map (hd0) (hd1) > map (hd1) (hd0) > map --hook > write (99) [FiraDisk]\nStartOptions=cdrom,vmem=find:/ISO/%MYISO%;\n\0 > chainloader (0xff)/BOOTMGR || chainloader (0xff)
[FiraDisk\auWin8.xml]<Key>
> <UserData> > <AcceptEula>true</AcceptEula> > <ProductKey> > <Key>TK8TP-9JN6P-7X7WW-RFFTV-B7QPF</Key> > </ProductKey> > </UserData>
C. Windows PE ``` 1\. Windows Automated Installation Kit(WAIK)Windows PE(BOOTMGR[boot][sources])Menu.lst ``` > title WinPE > find --set-root /BOOTMGR > chainloader /BOOTMGR ```

[winvblock.ima.gz](http://www.rmprepusb.com/documents/rmprepusb-beta-versions/winvblock.ima.gz?attredirects=0)(F:\BootUSB\winvblock.ima.gz) 4\. Menu.lst ``` > title Install Windows XP - STEP 1\nRemember press <F6> to load WinVBlock driver!! > set MYISO=XP.ISO > find --set-root --ignore-floppies --ignore-cd /winvblock.ima.gz > map --mem /winvblock.ima.gz (fd0) > map --mem /winvblock.ima.gz  (fd1) > # if this loads the ISO into memory slowly - then you need to run WinContig on the ISO file on your USB drive to speed it up! > map  /WXP/%MYISO% (0xff) || map  --mem /WXP/%MYISO% (0xff) > map (hd0) (hd1) > map (hd1) (hd0) > map --hook > root (0xff) > chainloader (0xff) > title  > Install Windows XP - STEP 2 (RAM > 1GB)\nContinue to install Windows XP with RAM > 1GB > set MYISO=XP.ISO > find --set-root --ignore-floppies --ignore-cd /winvblock.ima.gz > # we must load the ISO into memory, so it will be slow to load here ... > echo Loading... > map --mem /WXP/%MYISO% (0xff) || map  /WXP/%MYISO% (0xff) > map (hd0) (hd1) > map (hd1) (hd0) > map --hook > chainloader (hd0)+1 > pause Press ENTER and then unplug this USB drive... > title  > Install Windows XP - STEP 2 (RAM < 1GB)\nContinue to install Windows XP with RAM < 1GB > set MYISO=XP.ISO > map --mem /winvblock.ima.gz (fd0) > map --mem /winvblock.ima.gz  (fd1) > map /WXP/%MYISO% (0xA0) > checkrange 0x80 read 0x8280 && map (hd0) (hd1) > checkrange 0x80 read 0x8280 && map (hd1) (hd0) > map --hook > map --rd-size=2048 > map --mem (rd)+4 (0x55) > map --rehook > write (0x55) #!GRUB4DOS\x00v=1\x00WXP/%MYISO%\x00\xA0\x00 > root (hd0,0) > chainloader (hd0)+1 > pause Keep the USB drive connected until Setup completes! ``` 5\. USBWindows XPXPF6"FiraDisk Driver"USBWindows XP B. Windows 8 1\. Windows 8Windows 7Windows 8 ISO(Release PreviewServer 2012)([FiraDisk\au.xml]) 2\. ``` > title Install Windows 8\nThis will install Windows 8 to your hard disk > debug off > set MYISO=WIN8.ISO > dd if=()/firadisk/auWin8.xml of=()/AutoUnattend.xml > dd if=()/firadisk/spaces.txt of=()/firadisk/ISONAME.CMD > write ()/firadisk/ISONAME.CMD SET MYISO=\\iso\\%MYISO%\r\n > map --mem (md)0x800+4 (99) > map /ISO/%MYISO% (0xff) > map (hd0) (hd1) > map (hd1) (hd0) > map --hook > write (99) [FiraDisk]\nStartOptions=cdrom,vmem=find:/ISO/%MYISO%;\n\0 > chainloader (0xff)/BOOTMGR || chainloader (0xff)
[FiraDisk\auWin8.xml]<Key>
> <UserData> > <AcceptEula>true</AcceptEula> > <ProductKey> > <Key>TK8TP-9JN6P-7X7WW-RFFTV-B7QPF</Key> > </ProductKey> > </UserData>
C. Windows PE ``` 1\. Windows Automated Installation Kit(WAIK)Windows PE(BOOTMGR[boot][sources])Menu.lst ``` > title WinPE > find --set-root /BOOTMGR > chainloader /BOOTMGR ```
